docTitle.titlePart: Tunable coupling of flux qubits through a simple flux transformer

front.div:
Abstract
We sketch the way in which a monostable rf-SQUID can mediate an inductive coupling between
two adjacent flux qubits. The nontrivial dependence of the SQUID's susceptibility on external
flux makes it possible to continuously tune the induced coupling from antiferromagnetic (AF)
to ferromagnetic (FM). In particular, for suitable parameters, the induced FM coupling can be
sufficiently large to overcome any possible direct AF inductive coupling between the flux qubits.
